page.title: 02Employment in Colmonell
page.content: The past hundred years has seen a fundamental change in the employment pattern in Colmonell. This major change has come about as a result of improvements in agricultural methods and subsequent decline in manpower requirements.Local farms and estates employed large numbers of laborours before the coming of mechanisation,now they employ only a few skilled men. Out of a total working population of approximately 45 only 21 work in and around the village.These include local council workers,shopkeepers and a number of self employed tradesmen and agricultural contractors. The majority of workers who travel outwith the village work in Girvan,a distance of 12 miles away, or Ayr some 35 miles distant.
